ğ’€­ğ’•ğ’ƒ¶ [Dagon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dagon) (Phoenician: ğ¤ƒğ¤‚ğ¤ DÄgÅ«n; Hebrew: ×“Ö¸Ö¼×’×•Ö¹×Ÿ, DÄgÅn) ancient Mesopotamian and ancient Canaanite deity.  
ğ’€­ğ’•ğ’ƒ¶ Dagan worshipped as a fertility god in Ebla, Assyria, Ugarit, and among the Amorites.  
ğ’€­ğ’•ğ’ƒ¶ Dagan **grain** / agricultural god, Zeus Arotrios á¼„ÏÎ¿Ï„ÏÎ¿Î½, 'plow', "grain" siton  vs ğ“ƒ© [[ğ’…]]  
ğ’€­ğ’•ğ’ƒ¶ Dagan mermaid dag "fish" (as in Hebrew: ×“×’) originally a weather-god (*dgn 'to be cloudy') dag  vs ğ“ƒ© [[ğ’…]]  
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c3/Dagon1.jpg/440px-Dagon1.jpg)  
ğ’€­ğ’•ğ’ƒ¶ Dagan â‡”  [[ğ’…]] Tará¸«unnas Anatolian storm god?  

ğ’€­ğ’•ğ’ƒ¶ Dagan dag vs Marduk ğ’€­ğ’€«ğ’Œ“ ?  

9. month ğ’Œš ğ’ƒ¶ 		Kislimu 		 	Nergal  ğ’€­ğ’„Šğ’€•ğ’ƒ² 	Pabilsag (Sagittarius) - ğ’€¯ğ’‰ºğ’‰‹ğ’Š• 	Kislev ×›Ö´Ö¼×¡Ö°×œÖµ×• KÄnÅ«n al-Awwal  	Nov/Dec  


At [[Ebla]] (Tell Mardikh), from at least 2300 BC, Dagan was the head of the city pantheon comprising some 200 deities  
One entire quarter of Ebla and one of its gates were named after Dagan.  
Dagan is called ti-lu ma-tim, "dew of the land" and Be-ka-na-na, possibly "Lord of Canaan".  

Dagan ğ’€­ğ’•[[ğ’ƒ¶]] Deo Grain,  
Dagan ğ’€­ğ’•[[ğ’ƒ¶]] wife: Grain goddess [Shala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shala) / [Ishara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ishara) â‹ [[Ishtar]]  
Dagan ğ’€­ğ’•[[ğ’ƒ¶]] lives in E-Mul (house of stars)
